text:
Teens drive wrong way during police chase in Hamilton PHILLIPA YALDEN Last updated 08:25, February 24 2017 
Police laid spikes and tracked down four 16 year olds during a pursuit on the Waikato Expressway north of Hamilton. 
Driving on the wrong side of Hamilton expressway to try and flee police could've easily ended in tragedy, police say. 
The shocking manner of driving was used by one of four 16 year olds during a pursuit on Mangaharakeke Drive overnight. 
A police patrol spotted the stolen Mazda being driven dangerously around 2.30am, Senior Sergeant Robbie Hermann said. 
Police tried to stop the car but the driver fled, heading north along the expressway. 
During the nine minute pursuit Hermann said the driver drove the wrong way on the expressway, travelling down the off ramp onto the road. 
"They were going back and forward a bit. It was lucky there was no oncoming traffic. 
"The potential for a real tragedy here was so high." 
Spikes were laid, which slowed the stolen vehicle down. 
Near Onion Rd the car came to a stop and the four teenagers inside tried to run. 
But Hermann said a dog unit sniffed them out and within 10 minutes of abandoning the car all four were in police custody. Ad Feedback 
The driver has been charged with unlawfully taking a motor vehicle, reckless driving and failing to stop. 
Police charged the other three 16 year olds, all from Hamilton, with unlawfully getting into a motor vehicle. They are all due to appear in Youth Court on Friday. 
Hermann said the teens had allegedly pulled the ignition on the car to steal it from a University student earlier in the night. 
It was unclear how much damage had been done.
